com.psec.excel

Class WriteExcel.Area

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.psec.excel.WriteExcel.Area
  • Enclosing class:
    WriteExcel

    public static class WriteExcel.Area
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to specify the contents of a portion of a Sheet.

    • Method Detail

      • addDataFilterLine

        public WriteExcel.Area addDataFilterLine()
        Creates a Data filter line as row 0.

        If the top rows of a sheet has merged values, the Excel Data filter is impeded. Calling this method ensures row 0 of a sheet has an empty cell for every column in the sheet. This makes the Data filter function work properly.

      • addRow

        public WriteExcel.Area addRow(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> oRow)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds a row of columns to the Area row array.

        Each column string can contain a formatting mark which is parsed according to format specifier.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addRow

        public WriteExcel.Area addRow(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> oRow,
                              int nStripe)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds a row of columns to the Area row array and adds a stripe mark.

        Each column string can contain a formatting mark which is parsed according to format specifier.

        Parameters:
        nStripe - Stripe option. 0 - no stripe, odd number - #odd background, Even number - #evn background
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addRow

                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds a row of columns to the Area row array along with a row format specifier.

        Each column string can contain a formatting mark which is parsed according to format specifier.

        Parameters:
        sRowFmt - with a row format specifier of sRowFmt (a defined style)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • colWidth

        public WriteExcel.Area colWidth(int n1stCol,
                                int nLastCol,
                                int nChars)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets the width of a set of columns to nChars.

        This should be called after writeArea is called. It sets the specifed inclusive range of columns (0 basde within Area) to the nChars width.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • colWidth

        public WriteExcel.Area colWidth(int nCol,
                                int nChars)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets the width of the specified column to nChars.

        This should be called after writeArea is called. It sets the specifed column (0 based within Area) to the nChars width.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getAbsRow

        public int getAbsRow()
        Return next absolute row.
        Returns:
        sum of Row count plus header count plus Base row.

      • getBaseCol

        public int getBaseCol()
        Return absolute column of start of Area on sheet.
        Returns:
        value of nCol given to the createArea method call that created the area

        Return absolute row of start of Area on sheet.
        Returns:
        value of nRow given to the createArea method call that created the area

      • getDataRow

        public int getDataRow()
        Return absolute row of first data row.
        Returns:
        Sum of header count plus Base row.

      • getHdrCount

        public int getHdrCount()
        Return size of Header array.
        Returns:
        size of Rows array which is increased by header method calls

      • header

        public WriteExcel.Area header(java.lang.String sCols)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds a set of columns to the header array.

        The string sCols is split using the '/' character and then each column is stored as a value after storing any formatting or merge marks parsed according to format specifier.

        Parameters:
        sCols - The array of columns, each separated by the '/' character,
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • header

        public WriteExcel.Area header(java.lang.String sCols,
                              java.lang.String sHdrFmt)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds a set of columns to the header array and applies a default row format specifier.

        The string sCols is split using the '/' character and then each column is stored as a value after storing any formatting or merge marks parsed according to format specifier.

        Parameters:
        sCols - The array of columns, each separated by the '/' character,
        sHdrFmt - The name of a defined style.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • writeArea

        public WriteExcel.Area writeArea()
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Writes the Area to sCurrent sheet.

        After the cells are written, size calculations are performed on each column based on the data.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • zapColText

        public WriteExcel.Area zapColText(int nRow,
                                  int nCol,
                                  java.lang.String sText)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Changes the column text for nHdr and nCol.

        This should be called before writeArea is called. It changes the column text for the nRow and nCol within the Area (both 0 based). The text can have a format specification parsed according to format specifier.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • zapHdrFmt

        public WriteExcel.Area zapHdrFmt(int nHdr,
                                 int nCol,
                                 java.lang.String sFmt)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Changes the header format specifier for the specified nHdr and nCol.

        This should be called before writeArea is called. It changes the header format specifier for the nHdr and nCol within the Area (both 0 based).

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • zapHdrText

        public WriteExcel.Area zapHdrText(int nHdr,
                                  int nCol,
                                  java.lang.String sText)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Changes the header text for the specified nHdr and nCol.

        This should be called before writeArea is called. It changes the header value for the nHdr and nCol within the Area (both 0 based).

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
